isis.stitle: 9 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS INTERNATIONAL PS125-9A, PS140-9A, PSO125-9A, PSO140-9A AND PSO150-9A - REASSEMBLY - RANGE CASE

figure.caption: Figure 108. Install Range Countershaft Shims and Retainer Plates

step1.para: Install the range countershaft shims and retainer plates ( Figure 92).

note.para: The shims should be in line with the plate holes.

step1.para: Tighten bolts to value listed in the TORQUE CHART.

figure.caption: Figure 109. Check Main Box Countershaft End Play

step1.para: Next check the main box countershaft end play ( Figure 93). End play should be between .002" and .007" on each countershaft .

figure.caption: Figure 110. Re-Install Countershaft Reverse Gears

step1.para: Re-install the countershaft reverse gears ( Figure 94). These gears only fit in one position because of the blind spline. Tighten bolts to value listed in the TORQUE CHART.

figure.caption: Figure 111. Place Range Countershafts in Housing

step1.para: Place the range countershafts in the housing ( Figure 95). Install the reverse gear and thrust plate next.

figure.caption: Figure 112. Install High Range Drive Gear

step1.para: Now install the high range drive gear ( Figure 96). Align the timing marks.

figure.caption: Figure 113. Install Rear Clutch Drive Gear and Synchronizer Cup

step1.para: Install the rear clutch drive gear and the synchronizer cup ( Figure 97). Secure them with the washer and nut. Tighten bolts to value listed in the TORQUE CHART.

figure.caption: Figure 114. Install Synchronizer and Fork

step1.para: Install the synchronizer and fork with the synchronizer springs facing the output yoke or flange ( Figure 98). Keep the springs in place during installation.

figure.caption: Figure 115. Synchronizer Parts Are Available Separately

step1.para: Synchronizer parts are available separately ( Figure 99).

figure.caption: Figure 116. Install Low Range Gear

step1.para: The low range gear should be installed now ( Figure 100). Make sure the timing marks are aligned.

figure.caption: Figure 117. Lower Rear Case into Place

step1.para: Place the cone spacer on the output shaft. Continue by applying Loctite Gasket Eliminator (pur ple) or equivalent to the housing face, then lower the rear case into place ( Figure 101). Tighten bolts to value in the TORQUE CHART.

figure.caption: Figure 118. Install Matched Set of Bearings and Spacers Inside Bearing Cap

step1.para: Install the matched set of bearings and spacers inside the bearing cap ( Figure 102). These bearings must be replaced as a set.

figure.caption: Figure 119. Install Output Bearing Cap

step1.para: Install the output bearing cap as follows ( Figure 103):

step2.para: Use a depth gage and measure the distance from the end of the range case to the bearing cup (Dimension B).
Measure the thickness of the bearing retainer cap pilot (Dimension A).
Subtract A from B to determine the amount of shims to provide a tolerance of 0 to .004. Shims are .005 (.1270 mm) thick.
Tighten bolts to torque values specified in the TORQUE CHART.

figure.caption: Figure 120. Install Countershaft Bearings and Bearing Caps

step1.para: Install the countershaft bearings and bearing caps ( Figure 104). Align the bearing caps with the oil grooves in the case. Tighten bolts to torque value listed in the TORQUE CHART.

figure.caption: Figure 121. Assemble Spacers and Air Regulator

step1.para: Also assemble the two spacers and air regulator ( Figure 105). The air regulator bolts are longer than the bearing cap bolts.

figure.caption: Figure 122. Install Range Piston

step1.para: Install the range piston ( Figure 106). The counterbore on the piston should face the O-ring on the rod.

figure.caption: Figure 123. Install Retaining Nut and Tighten

step1.para: Install the retaining nut and tighten nut to torque value listed in the TORQUE CHART ( Figure 107). Lubricate the piston O-ring.

figure.caption: Figure 124. Install Range Piston Housing

step1.para: Next install the range piston housing with the four bolts ( Figure 108). The air inlet should be at the top. Tighten bolts to torque values listed in the TORQUE CHART.

figure.caption: Figure 125. Install Speedometer Gear and End Yoke or Flange

step1.para: The speedometer gear and end yoke or flange can be installed now ( Figure 109). Torque yoke or flange nut as specified in the TORQUE CHART.

figure.caption: Figure 126. Install Clutch Housing Retainer Bolts

step1.para: Place the transmission in a horizontal position. Install the two clutch housing retainer bolts next ( Figure 110). Tighten bolts to torque value listed in the TORQUE CHART.

figure.caption: Figure 127. Install Back-Up Light Switch and Pin

step1.para: Install the back-up light switch and pin ( Figure 111).

figure.caption: Figure 128. Install Air Control Valve Pins

step1.para: Shift all forks into neutral, then install the three air control valve pins ( Figure 112).

figure.caption: Figure 129. Place Interlock into Interlock Retaining Plate

step1.para: Insert the three poppet balls and springs into the case. Place the interlock into the interlock retaining plate, and install the assembly at this time ( Figure 113). Adjust the interlock to the proper position for a forward or center control. Secure the plate with two bolts. Tighten bolts to torque value listed in the TORQUE CHART.

figure.caption: Figure 130. Install Air Control Valve and Gasket

step1.para: Install the air control valve and gasket ( Figure 114). Tighten the retaining bolts to the value listed in the TORQUE CHART. Install the air lines, referring to the diagram in Figure 5. Always cut squarely with a sharp cutting tool.

figure.caption: Figure 131. Bench Shift Transmission

step1.para: Bench shift the transmission to make sure it is working correctly ( Figure 115).

figure.caption: Figure 132. Install Gasket and Shift Tower

step1.para: Reassembly is complete with the installation of the gasket and shift tower ( Figure 116). One gasket must be in place to assure proper gear selection. If this gasket is eliminated, binding may occur.

caution.para: Do not apply Loctite or any other sealant. It could prevent proper interlock functioning.

step1.para: Tighten the bolts to value listed in the TORQUE CHART.
